First, we need to understand what Whole Genome Sequencing is. Whole Genome sequencing is an automated sequencing technology that is used to gather all the DNA sequences of individuals or groups, as well as identifying any genetic differences or individuals. Now let's consider what Rosalind Franklin was known for. According to the Oxford English Dictionary, Rosemerel née Weill, was an American woman who lived in the 1950s and early 60s. knowledge: Whole genome sequencing . Whole genome sequencing should not be confused with DNA profiling, which only determines the likelihood that genetic material came from a particular individual or group, and does not contain additional information on genetic relationships, origin or susceptibility to specific diseases. In addition, whole genome sequencing should not be confused with methods that sequence specific subsets of the genome - such methods include whole exome sequencing (1% of the genome) or SNP genotyping (<0.1% of the genome).
